page.title: 01RURAL AREAS/BROMYARD
page.content: The Herefordshire/Worcestershire border, east of Bromyard, is a rural area with scattered population in most of the block, b ecoming more concentrated in the east around Suckley Green. The only village store is a small one in Spuare 8, and there is a post office in Square 2, on Bringsty common. However, the area is not far from the small town of Bromyard,which has adequate shopping facilities. The north west of the block is on Bringsty Common, which is a popular picnic area in summer,and has several football pitches. In the north of squares 1 & 2 is Brockhampton Park, a National Trust property, and there is deciduous woodland to a varying extent throughout the area. The bolock is prodominantly pasture land, with three quarters of the squares containing some cultivation.
